result.title: [Tutorial] Treasure Hunt
result.content:
B: Seif's Array

This problem can be solved greedily by keep choosing the minimum number of the array and increase it k times.

because If a < b, then b * (a + 1) > a * (b + 1).

This can be done in O(k * n) but this will lead to TLE, so we want to find an algorithm to get the minimum number as fast as we can.

Author's solution:

Sort the array and increase the last element which value equal to the minimum number (a[0]) .. this is can be done using binary search

This step will keep the array sorted no need to sort again! code

osamafathy's solution

Use priority queue (Min heap) to keep the minimum number in the top of the queue! code

These two solutions are O(n * log(n)).
